li:
Close the water when you don't need it (for example when you wash your teeth)
Half of the water we use goes to waste due to evaporation caused by over-watering

Don't leave the stand-by mode on in your electronic devices
Phantom load is 10% of the energy use in US

Use the same plastic or glass bottle you used yesterday
In 2015, every inhabitant of EU generated 166.3kg of plastic waste

Don't throw away your waste on the pavement (for example cigarettes if you smoke)
Plastic takes 450 years or more to decompose

Eat biological products
In EU, 500kg of fertilizers are used for every hectare of arable land

Use air conditioning or heating only if necessary
Older air conditioners can consume up to 800% electricity of the new air conditioners

Separate your waste into plastic, organic, glass, paper, non-recyclable waste
On a single run of the Sunday New York Times not recycled, 75.000 trees are wasted

Buy a reusable bag for your shopping
https://earth911.com/living-well-being/repurpose-food-packaging/

Use your remaining water to water the plants
The outflow of water in the UK is 171 billions mc per year

Use bike or public transport for your movements
On-road vehicles cause one-third of air pollution that produces smog in US
Reuse packages (for example parfumes, shoes and soap boxes)

Take a cold shower instead of a hot one
Cold water causes your blood to circulate at faster rates to mantain ideal body temperature

Buy something made of recyclable material
Using recycled materials in a construction can reduce it's environmental impact of 45%

Wherever you go, pick up the litter which is not in the bin
Billions of tons of litter are dumped into the ocean each year and besides the 250 million trashes that is being generated each year too

Buy food from local sellers (for example: meat or groceries)
Locally grown food reduces the present average of 1300 miles food travels from "field to plate"

Support the green areas of your town by using them
The Earth has lost more than half of it's trees since humans first learn how to weald the axe

Get informed about a green association
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_environmental_organizations

Watch a documentary about environmental topics
Here's an example

Make a marmelade from the fruit you don't eat
Here's a simple guide

Don't use disposable stuff
In the UK, 7 million disposable coffee cups are used every day

Try to understand how big your carboon footprint is
Here's a website to calculate your actual carbonm footprint

Try not to use elevators or escalators today
There are several benefits of using the stairs: it's free workout and it's an energy saver

Don't understimate the power of your bottle tops
In France, 485 million of bottle tops have been used to build an orphanage in Madagascar
Choose one of the previous missions and redo it with one of your friends
Invent your own green mission and, if you want, let us know
Buy the seeds of your favourite tree

Your world is beautiful: just relax and admire it
https://youtu.be/pLCSTn6_uU0

Plant the seeds you've bought (obviously, if you don't have a garden, you should go to a park)
https://www.treesaregood.org/treeowner/plantingatree
